items.headline: The Fed has a big decision to make without key data. Here’s what it could do.
items.summary_en: As they prepare to meet in 10 days on interest rates, Federal Reserve officials are very divided over a key question: How worried they ought to be about the U.S. labor market.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I would like to know the truth’: My stepgrandmother told me she left me her IRA. How do I find it?
items.summary_en: “She passed away in December 2025. So far, no one in the family has received anything from her estate.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘A friend calls it the everything bubble’: Why do so many economists fear a 1929-style crash?
items.summary_en: We have faced fears, for more than 10 years, that the market is going to experience the kind of crash not seen in nearly a century.

items.headline: Diane Keaton’s $29 million ‘house that Pinterest built’ was taken off market 2 weeks before she died
items.summary_en: Hollywood legend Diane Keaton’s beloved “house that Pinterest built” was quietly taken off the market just 2 weeks before her death at the age of 79.

items.headline: Brad Pitt and Ines de Ramon are ‘really making their home into a home’
items.summary_en: Brad Pitt and his girlfriend, Ines de Ramon, have reportedly moved in together—just weeks after the actor snapped up a brand-new $12 million home in Los Angeles.

items.headline: ‘I’m worried about hurt feelings’: I regret hiring my brother-in-law as my financial adviser. How do I fire him?
items.summary_en: “I do not know how to tell my brother-in-law that I am switching.”

items.headline: U.S. stocks remain a strong bet, thanks to a resilient consumer, says this European wealth manager
items.summary_en: Investors are climbing a “wall of worry,” when it comes to all-important U.S. assets. That shouldn’t deter them, says Indosuez Wealth Management’s chief strategist.

items.headline: This vital ingredient suggests the U.S. economy is still faring OK — with no recession brewing
items.summary_en: When the economy shows sign of stress, one of the first things Americans strike from their budgets are frequent takeout dinners and restaurant reservations. It’s one of the best early warning signs of recession.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: U.S. passport power plunges — and ‘worried’ Americans are searching for second passports and golden visas

items.headline: This government shutdown could be the longest ever — maybe running until Thanksgiving. What might the economic damage be?
